description: Jadeja striking with the arm ball, what a game for him, tossed up like the previous one, Root back in the crease waiting for the sharp turn away, there is none, it hurries in, and disturbs the stumps

got him now, the wide delivery working for Ishant third time, fuller this time, and Root was drawn forward at it, played away from the body with an open face, hint of away movement, and and a tumbling Dhoni snaps up the outside edge, steadying stand broken

oh no! Root goes for an uncharacteristic cross-batted shot and he misses. Jadeja normally keeps it a touch short of length and  Root didn't get to the pitch of the ball in his sweep, he misses and Jadeja hits off. Immediate impact.
Root's well-paced innings ends as he charges at Franklin and misses the smear to see his castle shattered

tries to be cute again and Root is bowled reverse-sweeping! McCullum tossed it up on middle and off, it perhaps hurried on a touch and Root missed trying to take the ball through the off side. Ring-a-ding-ding go the stumps

down the wicket and goes for a lofted on-drive, doesn't get into it properly and finds long on. Once again and England batsman gets going and then gets out, New Zealand strike to stymie any progress again. Root tried to clear the ropes from a ball tossed up on middle and off but he got it low on the bat I think and the catch was straightforward for the fielder running a few yards to his left
back to back wickets, Root clips a delivery from off stump straight to midwicket...Australia now making some significant inroads

slower ball on the stumps, 72mph, Root goes to play over the leg side, doesn't get hold of it and finally Sri Lanka hold a catch with Jayawardene clinging on to a simple chance at deep midwicket, bit of a top edge from Root but a fine innings played really well

step to leg, goes to swing over the leg side, he's late on the stroke and pulls straight up in the air and Ronchi takes an easy catch running out a little way towards square leg, Root got into an awkward position trying to pull a ball that was onto him a little quicker than he might have thought, may have bounced a little more too and put it straight up

goes to paddle sweep, misses and loses his leg stump beaten by a little turn and it came off the thigh pad into leg stump. An unnecessary dismissal but a fine hand from Root. He just got a bit too far outside off stump and by the time the ball turned inside him Root was leaning across for it and the paddle sweep missed

pulled and gets a top edge and Sharma comes in from deep backward square and takes the catch! India right into the game with another wicket. It was a back of a length ball on leg stump, Root went to pull and it came off a top edge and Sharma was able to take a few strides forward and take the catch

good length ball and straight through Root onto middle stump. It shaped back a little and Root was playing with half a bat trying to run it down to third man, poor stroke to a ball which deserved more respect. He came forward and thought it was going to slide across him but a little bit of seam movement has done for him

pops the ball back, Voges gets Root caught and bowled! Never let it be said Michael Clarke doesn't know what he's doing. Voges tossed it up, Root advanced but the ball stuck a little on the pitch and came straight back off the face of the bat, the bowler tumbled forward and held it well

full just outside off, Root drive at it and nicks to first slip!! McKay has a hat-trick!! Unbelievable! What a moment for McKay. Dan Christian took a hat-trick in March 2012 and now McKay has repeated the feat. A full ball a couple inches outside off stump, Root, like Trott, aimed a decent-strength drive at it, got a thinner edge but still healthy enough for it to carry through to Watson who held on down low, what a moment

full and wide of off stump, Root pokes at it without moving his feet and gets a thick inside edge onto his middle stump and that ends a very average innings from Root, he's looked rather out of touch today and played a poor stroke there. On a better day that would have been driven handsomely through the covers but a tentative prod has seen a thick inside edge smash into middle stump

full at the pads, Root misses and is struck on the pad, looks pretty straight and given out lbw. We do have reviews available and Root goes upstairs. There were two noises but it doesn't appear as if Root has hit this, nothing on Hot Spot and Hawk Eye has it crashing into leg stump. A very good decision from the umpire and you have to say not the best review from Root. He was done by some inswing and he missed playing across the line

Johnson gets Root! It seemed inevitable, and it's an lbw that gets him. Johnson gets this one to swing back in a fraction, at pace, and the only thing as slow as Root's attempt to get the bat down in time is Dharmasena's delayed decision to give that out. As he did in the first ODI, Root wants a review and as was the case then, he is still out. It was an umpire's call, replays suggesting it would have hit the leg bail. Really ungainly shot by Root, who just couldn't handle the pace

oh boy, now Root is gone! Does this match have a twist in the ending? Root has walked across his stumps and tried to paddle down to fine leg but he didn't get much on it and Doherty at short fine leg in the circle had no trouble taking that
he's on a roll! Root goes for the sweep, the ball loops off the glove and gives the keeper a simple catch

full length delivery, Root comes forward and presses it back up the wicket, in fact he's popped it back to Bravo who takes a straightforward chance going to his right at waist height. Little bit of pace off the ball perhaps? It didn't seem that way but Root was on the stroke much too soon and tapped a catch back to the bowler

tries to get cheeky with a reverse-lob and picks out short third man - Root toots his last! It was a sparkling, busy innings, has really set England up with their second-best fifth-wicket stand in ODIs. Bravo took the pace off and the attempt to loft it over the man on the edge of the circle didn't quite come off

the catching has held up superbly, this time a well-judged low take a deep midwicket as Root flicks a full delivery over the leg side - comes off the toe end of the bat - and Taylor dives forward to grab it
this time he's gone, goes down on on knee to sweep a back-of-the-hand slower ball and is taken on the knee roll. Having not advised Bopara to review he uses it himself but it's three reds

OH! And that's completely done Root in. The batsman misjudges the length completely, stays back to a length ball he could have come forward to, and what's more, played down the wrong line to a ball that seamed away. Root plays too straight and Malinga cleans up the off stump. England in a state early on.

plays across the line and a top edge flies to fine leg! Root falls in the 40s attempting to give Mathews the hurry up, maybe just stopped a little in the pitch and it ballooned off the bat, a simple catch for the man down there

full, Root goes to reverse sweep and misses, there's two cries, one for lbw and then, when the ball popped up to Sangakkara, for a catch behind. Not out given on both counts but they go for the review and it looks straight off the glove. Yep smack bang off the glove, straight up and Sangakkara takes the catch walking a yard in front of the stumps
and another! Hanging back proves his downfall. This delivery nips back off a length into Root and scoots between bat and pad into middle stump. Excellent from Bhuvi.

A beauty! Appeal for a stumping. Dhoni thinks he's got him. A lovely ball from Jadeja, gripped and spun past Root's edge as he lunged forward. Replays suggest Root's foot is only on the line, not behind it. Not looking good for him. Rob Bailey, the third umpire, having a lengthy look and he's given it.

another wicket to a sweep! A reverse one, this time. The ball was outside off, Root couldn't keep the ball down - although not sure if he was actually trying to - it comes off a top edge and loops to short third man. Awful timing for England. And the field was set for the reverse sweep

goes across his stumps, scoops... but straight to short fine leg! Root goes for 113, a rattling good innings though England would have loved him to still be there at the end. Tried to be a bit too cute, the ball was a half-volley on off stump, instead of hitting down the ground he ramped it softly to the fielder on the edge of the ring
fuller length, Root driving at it and edging behind! Root's poor footwork the undoing of him once again. Pushed back, then drawn forward and he gets a feather edge to the keeper

full length at the stumps, Root seems to play all around it, huge appeal for lbw and instantly given out. It seemed to be just a straight delivery angled into the stumps, Root was aiming too leg side and when he missed, he was in big trouble, Steve Davis greedily getting his finger up almost before Mathews had the chance to turn around

stays leg side of this again, goes to drive again and gets bowled! The change works for Sri Lanka, Herath has struck with perhaps a quicker ball that Root has misjudged. He should have been playing much straighter but tried to slash it square and missed, losing his middle and off stumps, partnership broken

goes for the scoop, misses and bowled! Root going right across his stumps and misses with an attempted scoop, losing his middle stump, embarrassment back on the cards for England. Nice and full and straight from the bowler, and when they miss, you know the rest

and now he's given! Going for the reverse sweep, misses the full delivery, and Rod Tucker is quick to say that's out. England have their review so Root reckons he may as well use it, but that looks fairly straight. Only an edge would save him, but it wasn't an instant review from Root. And it's hitting middle half-way up. That ends a fine series for Root, one of the England players who can hold their head high

Cummins as well, he gets Joe Root, England 12 for 3. Cummins had been pitching those on drivable length outside off and it pays off. Root drove this length delivery and edged it straight to Watson at first slip for an easy catch, around waist height
gone! That's a length ball outside off, it was there to be hit, but Root, clearing his front leg, couldn't get any elevation on it, and he ended up popping it straight into mid-on's hands

Binny has struck with a return catch! He pitched it up outside off, Root drove back firmly, but uppishly, and Binny grabbed it with both hands around waist height in his follow through. England three down before reaching 50

and he breaks through immediately, it is his day, what a delivery first up, no warm up business, yorker, full and straight, Root misses with the clip, pad is in the way of the stumps, agrees the umpire, that is taking out middle
two in two! And Marsh is sure pulling his weight! Becomes the fourth man on a hat-trick today as he gets Root to top-edge a short ball that Haddin tracks down around fine leg

Milne and Root have denied Southee a shot at best-ever figures in a WC match. Milne is short of a length again, Root looks to pull, it gets a bit big, takes the top edge, and settled with Vettori at fine leg

and another one! Root follows the rest. This is an excellent delivery at this juncture of the innings. Pitches on a length just outside off and straightens just a touch to kiss the outside edge. Not much Root could have done about that really. Excellent stuff.

Root has reviewed this. He has been given out lbw. Root has tried a reverse-sweep, and has missed it. This is a quicker flatter and straighter delivery. The problem with this shot it, Root is right in front of the stumps when hit by the ball, and that removes any doubt around this lbw decision. Projection shows impact in front of off, the ball clipping leg

and Mortaza produces the goods once again in the first over of a fresh spell as he succeeds in getting Root to play at this one which just holds its line after being bowled on a fuller length. Mushfiqur is able to take this from behind as Bangladesh exult with joy across the field. Really big wicket as Root was settling in for the potential heist later on

runs down the wicket, leans out to drive outside off and nicks to the keeper! The change works and Boult brings to an end a superb innings from Root. Leaning across to meet this, wasn't in control and got a thin edge behind

he's got him! That's a huge wicket for Santner. Root getting too far under this slog-sweep, getting more height than distance, he had to reach for it a little. Nathan McCullum takes a well-judged catch at midwicket

down the pitch looking to clip this leg side, it holds up slightly and takes the pad into leg stump! The breakthrough from Santner and he's bowled well to tie down the batsmen, pressure coming at both ends and Root has fallen trying to create something here. Looking to turn this out down towards long-on, he's been beaten on the inside edge and this takes a clip of the back pad into the top of leg stump

The third umpire called in for a stumping chace. Rochi fumbled on the first attempted but managed to take the bails off on the second. Santner's footing is fine. Santer gets turn outside off and lures Root out of the crease. He is beaten by spin, beaten in flight. The ball hit Ronchi just under the chin area, but he plucked it on the rebound off the chest to catch Root short. Santer strikes again!

rapped on the pads, the ball nipping back past inside edge... and given! Root decides to review after a brief word with Hales but this looked pretty adjacent, he was stuck on the crease and hit around the knee roll, looked like it would have juddered leg stump. Here comes Hawk-Eye... Yes, hitting the top of leg on umpire's call and Root heads off for a seven-ball duck having wasted England's one review
and the pressure tells! Wahab deserves that. Root has a swing across the line and leg stump gets hit

Root slogs a full toss straight to deep square leg! Wicket in his first over for Gohar, he'll bowl better balls for less reward in his international career, for sure, but they don't add descriptions in the scorebook. Root just shovelled it straight to Iftikhar a few yards in, took a good catch above his head
and he's got a wicket! Root goes for an expansive reverse sweep, doesn't make contact, then unbalances out of the crease and Sarfraz whips off the bails. Was that really needed from Root?
beautiful bowling! That's the sort of ball that's required on this deck. Very full length, lovely shape and late swing, and Root yorked himself as his bat came down across the line

on the move, tucked up, angled bat... and Root plays on! South Africa have their breakthrough and it's Abbott again! The Gopher of Economy has morphed into the Woodchuck of Penetration, he perhaps saw Root coming and dropped short, cramped him for space and he could only deflect the ball down on to his stumps

full length outside off, Root goes across and tries to scoop... and sends it up and down, straight to short fine leg! Nice idea but he got more elevation than length and Tahir makes no mistake, hovering underneath it. Root was completely out of gas, no more running for him as he tried to make the ball do the work

huge appeal for lbw, and given after the review! Given not out first of all as Root misses his sweep, Tahir is desperate for the review, he was calling for it in his follow through! Tahir is convinced. Don't think there's any bat. No edge showing up. This is pretty straight by the looks of it. He's got a good stride in, but that doesn't mean much these days. Three reds! And he's gone. Tahir was right.

another inducker, and Root is all at sea for this one! A 77mph stump-splatterer, just ghosting in from outside off, inexorably inwards. Root plays back, plays round it, loses his off pole, and his relative slump in form continues...
and there's the breakthrough! Root has given that away a bit...goes for the sweep and gets a gentle top edge which loops to short fine leg
Root got a life in the nineties. Root falls in the nineties. This was the back of the hand legcutter. 112ks. Root dances out and misses the leg-side swipe. Timbaaah!

a massive mow from a full-length delivery. Root was through his shot early as he sought to close in on his hundred, and emitted a long low groan like a harpooned whale as the ball spiralled into the air and plopped into the hands of cover. The end of another fine match-sealing innings. It looks tight on the scoreline, but it would be remarkable if England lost it from here ...

skidding on, into the gloves, Pakistan celebrate... and up goes the finger! Root was attempting to force the ball off the back foot, he got the thinnest of edges but Sarfraz knew, he held on and Pakistan have got both set batsmen in the space of seven balls. Root looks miffed to have missed out on a century but it was another fine knock

stays in the crease this time, and Root has picked the wrong ball to pull! Not desperately short, and Root gets a fat steepling top-edge, straight to Irfan at deep fine leg! The six in a row goes begging, and England are officially in a contest here!
big wicket! Root going for a drive, gets an inside edge which demolishes leg stump...Root indicates the ball just nipped back a touch.

misjudged to begin with but Pandya adjusts well to take the catch at long-on. Another wily slower ball from Bumrah, Root clears the front leg to slog this length ball straight to long-on. Pandya has started to run in, then realises it is sailing over, and then backtracks to take it overhead

Ashwin breaks the century stand in his first over. Tossed-up offbreak, does not turn much but dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Root goes low for a slog-sweep, probably bounced higher. He does not get hold of it. Only skies it in the air off a top edge. Kohli runs in and settles under it at midwicket

bowled him, stumps akimbo! Gabriel goes straight through Root, maybe low bounce again but that was quick, it hit the seam and hurtled back to kersplat the stumps with Root stuck in the crease... That's a big blow, England rocking, Gabriel rolling

no, he falls next ball! Joseph delivers it cross-seam on off stump, bottom-handed scoop from Root... but it's down the throat of long-on! Looked a tired shot, trying to whip across the line and got a big leading edge, Brathwaite steadies himself and makes no mistake

skips out and launches the ball... straight to mid-off! Root departs trying to lift the tempo, solid connection on the shot but didn't get enough elevation and he ended up drilling it to the man on the edge of the ring

bouncer, Root swings in ungainly fashion and top edges... safely taken by Amla running square from midwicket! Phehlukwayo has another, he's using his variations well, Root was getting itchy and tried to shovel over the leg side, came high off the bat and looped tamely towards the edge of the circle

trapped in front! Parnell beats him past the inside edge, booming swing - and England are two down! Lovely shape on that delivery, which started outside off and curled back in as Root aimed a punch down the ground. No hesitation from Michael Gough and it looked pretty plumb

dragged on! That's a big blow, and the product of Root's failure to get enough of the strike in recent overs. A flat-footed carve, aiming through the off-side, and instead taking out his own poles to send the zing-bails into ecstasy

gone, the outside edge this time snapped up by Wade! Another big breakthrough, Hazlewood clenches his fists as Root departs, more excellent line bowling and it nipped to kiss the edge, a simple catch for the keeper this time

got him, nicked to the keeper trying to cut! Shadab-a-dab-a-doo, Pakistan break through! Root drags himself away in a huff but there was a clear top edge on that, some extra bounce as he went back, smartly held by Sarfraz at the wicket
gosh, a wicket! Back of a length, Root defends with a hop but the ball gets big on him and deflects straight down into the timbers. Too little too late?

given lbw! That looks good. Root has reviewed, but unless he's hit it that seems gone. Misses the inside edge. Smashing leg stump. Trying to work a straight delivery to leg and another century goes begging. Wasted review
he's been given caught behind! Joseph has three...dropped in short, that's normally meant runs today, but this time he gets a thin bottom edge...more toe end, in fact

135 kph, the first today but may not be the last. Root chops on. Was just saying Root is so good at finding gaps, and his natural instinct of trying to do so kicks in. It's a good length delivery outside off that seams back in, with Hazlewood's natural angle. The safer shot would have been playing with a full face, but Root tries to cut this down to third man for a run. It's not wide enough for that, but he still may have got away with it on a quicker surface, but not this. Hits off stump and England now in trouble. Batsmen will have to get forward and play with the full face.

dug in, Root wafts at a pull, gets a big, ballooning top edge... and Hazlewood pockets the catch at fine leg! Root bags a duck and England are four down! Good pace and bounce, the bumper got too big for Root and he sent it right down the fielder's gullet. This could get ugly
smashed high and hard, but not high enough! In the slot once again, Root got underneath his shot, much like Roy before him, and picks out the man right back on the fence

breaches his defences! Munro has induced a whip across the line from Root. It looks like it's a knuckle ball too. Whether he meant it or not is unclear, but Munro is screaming in celebration. It's full and angled in at off stump. Root goes across the line and leaves a big gap as he tries to drill it through midwicket. Munro hits off stump

taken by de Grandhomme! Another catch for the series highlights reel! So good that catch was that Root first called "yeah". He had thought it passed de Grandhomme. On the pads from Boult, it's a scoring opportunity, at least that's what Root thinks. He fails to keep it down, the ball lobs to de Grandhomme's right. Both feet off the ground, one hand outstretched to his right, the ball meets palm and Root is gone. Some fine fielding today.

down the wicket, and Root has thrown it away! A stunning low grab at mid-off, but Root completely scuffed his attempted lofted drive, dragging across the ball and picking out Sodhi, diving to his right!

"yesss," says Latham as he takes this down leg side. The umpire raises his finger. Root appears to have gloved this hook shot. Bouncer doesn't come on as quickly as he expects it to. He's inside the line and playing away from his body by the time it arrives
